result.execSummary:
The defendant Benjamin R Groth was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Methamphetamine [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Def to undergo Alcohol and Drug Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommendations.
.

Def is not to consume or possess any alcohol, drugs, or controlled substances without a prescription from licensed physician, with random testing
.

Comply with mental health treatment recommended

Take all prescribed medications as directed

Complete any other evaluations / assessments deemed appropriate by the PO

Pay Crime Lab and Drug Assessment fee (see 'other' above for amount)

Pay DOC Supervision fees

Credit for 2 days if probation is ever revoekd

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of resititution victims and/or govermental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt

supervisions.notes:
The defendant is to serve the first 75 days in custody of jail without release and remaining balance of the sentence can be served on Electronic Monitoring with Justice Support Services

Unpaid Court costs/fees are converted to a Civil Judgment - PO is to provide Order to the Court
.
